body:
Is it possible to cherry pick this and make a hotfix version for 1.3.1? Or any other suggestions to get this fix sooner than later? Thank you! 

We are using 1.3.1 currently.
There is another critical fix #2995 needed by Pinot. Do you think you can make a new release?

Had an offline discussion with @himanshukandwal 
Helix depends on ZK event sequence and assume fifo change sequence. Manually adding an event may break some assumptions.
We should experiment if it is possible for customers to create unique workload name (like monotonic increasing naming).
Generally LGTM. Please address final comments.

body:
Pull request approved by: @xyuanlu 
Commit message: Fix endless creation of best possible nodes triggered by unintended modification of cached best possible map. The baseline and bestPossible maps are type Map<String, ResourceAssignment>. When this map is stored in the cache by persistBaseline() and persistBestPossibleAssignment(), the ResourceAssignment objects can still be accessed and modified after calling the relevant persist method. This change creates a deep copy of the assignment map with new ResourceAssignment objects to prevent unintended modification of the cached assignment after the call to persist.

Pull request approved by: @xyuanlu 
Commit message: Add atomic recursive delete to ZK client and use for drop instance
Thanks @xyuanlu for the feedback. Closing this PR for now.
This is a bit complex change, even though code change is short, the logic is pretty complex. Could you please add a bit more explain in commit message please? thx

Pull request approved by: @xyuanlu 
Commit message: Fix waged instance capacity npe on new resource by clearing the WAGED capacity map whenever there are no WAGED resources in the cluster. This will prevent a stale map from being used once a new resource is added.

body:
Pull request approved by: @xyuanlu 
Commit message: Add new ParticipantDeregistrationStage to handle removing instances that have been offline greater than customer set timeout. This timeout is determined by the value of PARTICIPANT_DEREGISTRATION_TIMEOUT in the cluster config. If the field is not set, then no participants will be deregistered.

body: I think Helix UI is already deprecated. No release for UI and code will be removed after 2.0 release.
I feel like changing log level might be a better approach, and it could be enabled if needed...
